content: give me a short c code

Certainly, here's a simple C program that will print the "Hello, World!" message to the console, which is often used as a first program when learning a new programming language:

```c
#include <stdio.h> // Include the standard input/output header file

int main() {
    // The main function - where the program starts executing
    printf("Hello, World!\n"); // Print the message to the console
    return 0; // Indicate that the program executed successfully
}
```

To compile and run this program, you would typically use a C compiler such as `gcc`. Here's how you might do it on a terminal or command prompt:

```
gcc -o hello hello.c
./hello
```

In the above commands, `gcc -o hello hello.c` compiles the source code file `hello.c` into an executable named `hello`, and `./hello` runs the compiled program. Remember, this is a simple example to get you started!å–µ~
